page.title: 07Forestry-part 1
page.content: THE VILLAGE OF ACHNAMARA WAS BUILT BY THE FORESTRY COMMISSION TO HOUSE IMMIGRANT FOREST WORKERS, LOCALS PROVIDING A SMALL PERCENTAGE OF THE LABOUR FORCE MECHANISATION HAS CHANGED THE FACE OF FORESTRY IN KNAPDALE.THE INTRODUCTION OF THE FORWARDER, PROCESSOR AND THE HARVESTER HAVE RESULTED IN GREATER EFFICIENCY BUT FEWER JOBS.SINCE THE VILLAGE WAS FOUNDED THE NUMBER OF FORESTRY WORKERS HAS FALLEN FROM ABOUT 80 TO 3O.MUCH OF THE MANAGEMENT WORK HAS REMAINED UNALTERED EXCEPT FOR THE INTRODUCTION OF CHEMICAL WEEDING.THE WORK OF THE F.C. CAN BE DIVIDED INTO 2 SEPARATE PARTS HARVESTING AND MANAGEMENT. HARVESTING IS FELLING AND EXTRACTION OF STANDING MATURE TIMBER TO THE ROADSIDE.THE CHAINSAW AND WINCH HAVE BEEN REPLACED BY THE HARVESTER AND FORWARDER.continued on page 8
